chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
items.plainText: My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

items.text: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.
items.plainText: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.

items.text: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
items.plainText: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?

items.text: Hast thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?
items.plainText: Hast thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?

items.text: Are thy days as the days of man? are thy years as man's days,
items.plainText: Are thy days as the days of man? are thy years as man's days,

items.text: That thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?
items.plainText: That thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?

items.text: Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand.
items.plainText: Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand.

items.text: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
items.plainText: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.

items.text: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
items.plainText: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?

items.text: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?
items.plainText: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?

items.text: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.
items.plainText: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.

items.text: Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
items.plainText: Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.

items.text: And these things hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this is with thee.
items.plainText: And these things hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this is with thee.

items.text: If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
items.plainText: If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.

items.text: If I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;
items.plainText: If I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;

items.text: For it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.
items.plainText: For it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.

items.text: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.
items.plainText: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.

items.text: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!
items.plainText: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!

items.text: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
items.plainText: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.

items.text: Are not my days few? cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
items.plainText: Are not my days few? cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,

items.text: Before I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;
items.plainText: Before I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;

items.text: A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
items.plainText: A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
